IRPact_modellierung.network

Class SocialGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • IRPact_modellierung.SimulationEntity
      • IRPact_modellierung.network.SocialGraph
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommunicationGraph, TrustGraph

    public abstract class SocialGraph
extends SimulationEntity
    The SocialGraph describes the structure of the interaction of the ConsumerAgents within the simulation. As a graph it comprises nodes (corresponding to the ConsumerAgents) and edges (standing for their interaction), The edges are associate with a certain EDGEMEDIUM, specifying what interaction the edge stands for. The SocialGraph further manages data structures to derive the neighbours of a node (given a certain medium), an to access all edges stemming from a node (for all or a specific medium).

    • Constructor Detail

      • SocialGraph

        public SocialGraph(SimulationContainer associatedSimulationContainer,
                   SNConfiguration sNConfiguration,
                   java.util.Set<SNNode> nodes,
                   java.util.Set<SNEdge> edges,
                   java.util.EnumMap<SocialGraph.EDGEMEDIUM,java.util.HashMap<SNNode,java.util.Set<SNNode>>> neighbours)
        The SocialGraph is a directed graph describing the structure of interactions (corresponding to the edges) of ConsumerAgents (corresponding to the nodes) with a given semantics (corresponding to the edge mediums). In this constructor the graph is already initialized with the set of edges and neighbourhood relations.
        Parameters:
        associatedSimulationContainer - The container the social network is situated in
        sNConfiguration - The configuration object of the corresponding instance of SocialGraph
        nodes - The nodes in the SocialGraph
        edges - The edge in the SocialGraph
        neighbours - The neighbourhood relations of the SocialGraph

      • SocialGraph

        public SocialGraph(SimulationContainer associatedSimulationContainer,
                   SNConfiguration sNConfiguration,
                   java.util.Set<SNNode> initialNodes)
        The SocialGraph is a directed graph describing the structure of interactions (corresponding to the edges) of ConsumerAgents (corresponding to the nodes) with a given semantics (corresponding to the edge mediums). This constructor is intended for situations where a partial graph needs to be initialized with a number of initialNodes (such as in a scale free graph initialization). In this constructor no edges are included in the graph.
        Parameters:
        associatedSimulationContainer - The container the social network is situated in
        sNConfiguration - The configuration object of the corresponding instance of SocialGraph
        initialNodes - The nodes the SocialGraph is based on

      • SocialGraph

        public SocialGraph(SimulationContainer associatedSimulationContainer,
                   SNConfiguration sNConfiguration,
                   int numberOfNodes)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The SocialGraph is a directed graph describing the structure of interactions (corresponding to the edges) of ConsumerAgents (corresponding to the nodes) with a given semantics (corresponding to the edge mediums). This constructor is intended for situations where a partial graph needs to be initialized with a number of initial nodes (such as in a scale free graph initialization). In this constructor no edges are included in the graph.
        Parameters:
        associatedSimulationContainer - The container the social network is situated in
        sNConfiguration - The configuration object of the corresponding instance of SocialGraph
        numberOfNodes - The number of nodes the SocialGraph is to be initialized with
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when the number of nodes to add is negative

        public void addIsolatedNode(SNNode nodeToAdd)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a node to the SocialGraph without introducing any edges involving this node. Will add the node to the existing data structures
        Parameters:
        nodeToAdd - The node to add to the graph
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when the node to add is already part of the SocialGraph

      • removeEdge

        public void removeEdge(SNEdge edgeToRemove)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Removes the given edge from the SocialGraph
        Parameters:
        edgeToRemove - The edge to remove from the graph
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when the edge is not part of the graph

      • replaceEdge

        public void replaceEdge(SNEdge edgeToReplace,
                        SNEdge replacingEdge)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Replaces an edge in the SocialGraph with another edge in the graph. Will throw an error when the replacing edge is already part of the graph or the edgeToReplace is not.
        Parameters:
        edgeToReplace - The edge in the graph that is replaced
        replacingEdge - The edge in the graph that replaces the respective edge
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when either the edgeToReplace is not part of the graph or the replacingEdge already is

      • modifyEdgeSource

        public void modifyEdgeSource(SNEdge edgeToModify,
                             SNNode newSource)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to change the source node of an edge as long as no edge structurally equivalent to the new edge exists yet (i.e. from same node to same node via the same medium)
        Parameters:
        edgeToModify - The edge that is to be changed
        newSource - The node the new edge is to be pointing from
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when the edge that is changed or the new target node is not part of the social graph, or when the edge has no medium associated to it.

                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:
        edgeToModify - The edge that is to be changed
        newTarget - The node the new edge is to be pointing towards
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when the edge that is changed or the new target node is not part of the social graph, or when the edge has no medium associated to it.

      • retrieveEdge

        public SNEdge retrieveEdge(SNNode sourceNode,
                           SNNode targetNode,
                           SocialGraph.EDGEMEDIUM respectiveMedium)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Retrieves the edge between the sourceNode and the targetNode of the respectiveMedium. Edge needs to exist; otherwise an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        sourceNode - The node the edge directs from
        targetNode - The node the edge directs towards
        respectiveMedium - The medium of the edge
        Returns:
        The edge of the respectiveMedium from the sourceNode to the targetNode
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when the respective edge doesn't exist

      • retrieveAllEdges

        public java.util.Set<SNEdge> retrieveAllEdges(SNNode sourceNode,
                                              SNNode targetNode)
        Method to retrieve all edges (of any medium) between the sourceNode and the targetNode. Result set will be empty when no edges exist between them
        Parameters:
        sourceNode - The node from which the edges stem from
        targetNode - The node the edges are directed to
        Returns:
        The set of edges of any medium from the sourceNode to the targetNode

      • getNeighbours

        public java.util.EnumMap<SocialGraph.EDGEMEDIUM,java.util.Set<SNNode>> getNeighbours(SNNode node)
        Method deriving all nodes the node of interest has an edge towards by the medium of interest
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose neighbour relation is to be derived
        Returns:
        An EnumMap with all neighbouring nodes of node by medium

      • getNeighbours

        public java.util.Set<SNNode> getNeighbours(SNNode node,
                                           SocialGraph.EDGEMEDIUM medium)
        Method to derive all nodes the node of interest has an edge towards via the specified medium
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose neighbours to derive
        medium - The medium via which the neighbours are to be derived
        Returns:
        The set of neighbour nodes via the EDGEMEDIUM relation

        public void addNodes(SNConfiguration sNconfiguration,
                     java.util.Set<SNNode> nodesToAdd)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        (Network type specific) method to add a number of nodes (and the edges that go with them) to the social graph
        Parameters:

        nodesToAdd - The nodes to be added to the social graph
        Throws:

        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • createEdges

        protected abstract java.util.Set<SNEdge> createEdges(SNConfiguration sNConfiguration,
                                                     java.util.Set<SNNode> initialNodes)
                                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        (Network type specific) method to generate edges between a set of initial nodes. Specifies how edges are (initially) created. Generated edges need to be included in the neighbourhood relations (method only derives WHICH edges to create).
        Parameters:
        sNConfiguration - The configuration of the social graph of interest
        initialNodes - The nodes the social graph should be initialized with
        Returns:
        A set of edges of the social graph it is initialized with
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when the configuration is errornous
